infotexts.entitydescription.scp_tar4a3: A strange looking weapon with unorthodox furniture and ergonomics, evidently not being all that suited for human hands, a slot behind the grip is used to house some sort of battery cell.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_tar4mag: A strangely textured 65 round 4x48mm Fractal Box Magazine.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_tbr6a4: An incredibly weird looking weapon that vaguely resembles some sort of rifle, a slot below the handguard used to house some form of battery cell.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_tbr6mag: A heavy 50 round 7.5mm Fractal Box Magazine.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_tb1: A large and unwieldy Pistol that presumably served as a sidearm for the long gone Fractals, a slot behind where the slide is is used to house some sort of battery cell.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_tb1mag: A hefty 9 round 14.5x41mm magazine of Fractal origin.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_tbsr7: A weirdly designed Rifle that is almost impossible to hold correctly due to it's size and weight, a slot behind the grip is used to house some sort of battery cell.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_tbsr7mag: A heavy 5 round 15x120mm Fractal Box Magazine.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_tmg12: A massive and very unwieldy weapon with a remarkably strange looking feeding system, which also appears to be the housing point of some form of battery cell.
infotexts.entityname.scp_tmgboxmag: Fractal General Purpose Machine Gun Box Magazine
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_tmgboxmag: A bulky 100 round 9.5mm belt fed box magazine that looks strangely terrestrial.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_tsg15: An odd looking shotgun of Fractal origin, utilising drum magazines that are strangely magnetized to the magwell.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_tsg15drummag: A strange 20 round 10 gauge drum magazine containing shells that resemble flechettes, however are significantly more efficient at armour penetration due to their sophisticated and complex design.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_tpdw57: An unconventional looking weapon of ancient Fractal origin, very vaguely resembling a terrestrial design.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_tpdw57mag: A boxy 50 round 5.7x35mm magazine for the Fractal PDW.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_tm3: An uttery gigantic and incredibly heavy weapon using multiple barrels. The internals are impossible to access thus making its inner workings very difficult to work out.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_tm3mag: A very heavy 200 round 4x48mm drum magazine that inserts into the size of the Rotary Cannon.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_fractalbatterycell: A large, very energy dense Battery Cell used to power energy demanding weaponry, using a poorly understood capacitor matrix to contain several megawatts of power inside. Due to their complexity it is impossible to disassemble without destroying the components.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_556mag: A common polymer 30 round 5.56x45mm magazine found all across Europa, the cartridge being light and easy to produce, though aren't known for stellar performance against armour.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_556extmag: A Polymer 60 round 5.56x45mm drum for extended or multiple engagements.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_m4s90: A high quality 12 Gauge Semi Auto Shotgun meant to be an improvement over simpler pump action designs, having a large magazine tube and much better firepower on demand.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_m590: A common 12 gauge shotgun found in the hands of Coalition rookies and some civilians who can get their hands on it, being a vast improvement over the older, cruder riot shotgun.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_rm93: A 12 gauge pump action used as a more mass produced option compared to the Coalition's counterpart, featuring a meagre 6 round tube and a semi-stiff pump. Regardless it gets the job done.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_rsh12: A large 12.7x55mm revolver with questionably high recoil, but regardless provides immense power in a handgun package. It has a heavy double action trigger mechanism.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_arevolverround: A large 12.7x55mm cartridge with a supersonic load, significantly increasing recoil but hitting a lot harder.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_arevolverduraround: A large 12.7x55mm cartridge using immense amounts of powder and a substantially tough projectile, capable of penetrating through multiple objects.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_deagle: A large and unweidly gas operated 12.7x33mm pistol, carried around by individuals to show superiority due to it's intimidating profile, price tag and unusual operation.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_deaglemag: A 10 round 12.7x33mm magazine, containing large cartridges meant for maximum effectiveness out of an autoloading handgun.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_deagleincendmag: A 10 round 12.7x33mm magazine containing large cartridges with an Incendiary core, capable of causing grevious burn injuries whilst being worse against armour.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_python: A compact 9x33mm revolver, made to replace the clunkier 9x29mm revolvers. It has a light double action trigger mechanism and can chamber 9x29mm cartridges.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_revolvercoalition: An elegant 9x33mm revolver, given to those who are seen very favorably in the eyes of the Coalition. It has a double action trigger that can be pre-cocked to a silky hair trigger, and can chamber 9x29mm cartridges in a pinch.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_357round: A 9x33mm cartridge made to replace the older and rather weak 9x29mm cartridges mainly used in older revolvers.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_sg550: A standard issue 5.56x45mm Assault Rifle designed to be a general purpose weapon for flexibility in almost any situation. It is a very common sight on submarines and in the hands of Coalition forces.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_val: A 5.45x39mm Assault Rifle with an integral suppressor designed for close quarters, being favoured by both the Separatists and Coalition for it's close range lethality.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_valmag: A polymer 20 round 9x39mm magazine containing Titanium AP ammunition, significantly increasing capabilities against armour which standard cartridges struggle against.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_valextmag: A quite long polymer 30 round 9x39mm magazine, housing subsonic projectiles that can shred through unarmoured targets.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_ash12: A top of the line 12.7x55mm rifle designed for CQC engagements, it's excellent firepower and compact package making it a favourite for assault teams for attacking vessels and outposts, though very hard to wield.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_malyuk12: A semi-crude looking 12.7x55mm rifle sharing parts with the Renegade BR, evidently being more available for the Separatists. It fires significantly faster though as a result puts a lot of demand on the shooter.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_ash12mag: A 10 round 12.7x55mm magazine loaded with Overpressured Durasteel cartridges, significantly increasing it's already devastating effect against body armour.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_ash12extmag: A hefty 20 round 12.7x55mm magazine, the cartridges being infamously reliable against both unarmoured and armoured targets alike.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_9mmmag: A basic 20 round 9x19mm magazine containing JHP ammunition, providing effective defense against soft targets, though fairs horribly against any sort of armour.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_meusoc: An 11.4x23mm pistol meant to be a more powerful option given 9x19's poor general performance, however recoils more and has limited capacity.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_m1911: A slick 11.4x23mm pistol that sits well in the hand, carefully assembled by the Separatists for their favored mariners, has a decent bit of recoil for the hefty cartridge, but the mag catch accepts SMG magazines with fervor.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_45mag: A 10 round 11.4x23mm magazine containing JHP ammunition, the large projectiles providing decent terminal effect though are woeful against armour.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_p226: A simple and prolific 9x19mm handgun being found almost everywhere and is a standard Coalition sidearm, despite the cartridge's lackluster capabilities.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_mxa1: A mostly polymer 6.5x39mm Assault Rifle that acts as an upgrade to standard 5.56 rifles with a more powerful cartridge in a lighter package.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_65mag: A polymer 30 round 6.5x39mm magazine containing unconventional C-FMJ cartridges.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_65incendmag: A polymer 30 round 6.5x39mm magazine containing highly unusual C-AP-IL cartridges, having a better effect against body armour though has a tendency to cauterize wounds.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_65duramag: A polymer 30 round 6.5x39mm magazine containing specially-tooled durasteel cartridges, it's hardened rounds having great effect against body armor.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_mag: A hefty 7.62x51mm machine gun, using a rifle cartridge to provide significant sustained fire though has it's size can be obtrusive.
infotexts.entityname.scp_pkpboxmag: General Purpose Machine Gun Box Magazine
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_pkpboxmag: A bulky 100 round 7.62x51mm belt fed box magazine for General Purpose Machine Guns.
infotexts.entityname.scp_pkpboxdumag: General Purpose Machine Gun DU Box Magazine
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_pkpboxdumag: A bulky 100 round 7.62x51mm belt fed box magazine for General Purpose Machine Guns, featuring a belt of Depleted Uranium cartridges which can zip through most objects.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_ksg: A very unconventional 12 gauge shotgun design, using 2 tubes for double the capacity over most similar shotguns whilst also being much better built.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_scar17: A large 7.62x51mm rifle chambering a much more powerful cartridges than more common rifles, being favoured by Coalition crews given their superior power despite the higher maintenance costs.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_g3: A 7.62x51mm rifle used predominantly by the Separatists with it's longer barrel providing more muzzle energy. However, the weapon uses a large, heavy bolt and off-axis stock, which severely worsens felt recoil.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_scar20: A 7.62x51mm rifle based off of the Battle Rifle, providing a longer free floating barrel and scope mount for excellent accuracy, the inherent size however make it difficult for inexperienced users to quickly fire accurately. A skilled Rifleman can make better use of this weapon.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_tabuk: A 7.62x39mm Marksman Rifle based off of the Separatist's mainstay AR, capable of sporting a scope. It's an odd choice given the cartridge has poor long range properties, however that evidently didn't stop the designer. A skilled Rifleman can make better use of this weapon.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_scarmag: A 20 round 7.62x51mm magazine containing FMJ cartridges, being naturally more bulky though such big projectiles are effective against both semi-armoured and unarmoured targets.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_scarduramag: A 20 round 7.62x51mm magazine containing rare Durasteel AP cartridges, being significantly more armour effective than FMJ.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_scarextmag: A large 40 round 7.62x51mm drum containing FMJ cartridges, giving more firepower on hand at the cost of bulk.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_t5000: A large 8.6x70mm rifle designed for quickly and precisely taking out a single person, it is a rare sight on Europa given it's long range niche is very situational.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_t5000boxmag: A small 5 round 8.6x70mm box magazine containing FMJ ammunition.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_m24: An 8.6x70mm rifle made to be an alternative to the Coalition's more fine-crafted Precision Rifle. The cartridge's recoil is intense as it clearly was a design that wasn't meant to use it.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_m14: A 7.62x51mm Battle Rifle that is well outdated compared to it's modern counterparts, it has a notable degree of accuracy alongside retaining a brisk firerate, though it is hard to control in anything more than a short burst.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_smg9: A common 9x19 SMG meant for giving full auto capabilities to the weak pistol cartridge, it's generally found in the hands of civillians or crew members for some level of protection.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_9mmsmgmag: A 35 round 9x19mm SMG magazine, providing decent capacity despite the inherent terrible armour defeating capabilities.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_9mmsmgdrummag: A big 70 round 9x19mm drum providing significantly more ammo on demand.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_ump45: A rugged 11.4x23mm Submachine Gun. It uses a heftier cartridge than it's lighter counterpart, though it's heavier bolt notably reduces firerate and is not as commonly seen.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_umpmag: A 25 round 11.4x23mm stick magazine containing JHP cartridges, providing a bit more punch than 9x19 though still performs terribly against armour.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_umpincendmag: A 25 round 11.4x23mm stick magazine containing FMJ-IL cartridges, designed to cause severe burns on contact with skin.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_ar50: A very heavy 12.7x99mm, single shot bolt action Anti-Materiel Rifle originally designed for destroying important submarine or outpost assets, but will deal with a person just fine.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_50bmgfmj: A large 12.7x99mm FMJ cartridge which is easily the biggest available for a handheld weapon. It is incredibly powerful when used against even armoured targets. Capable of penetrating submarine hulls.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_50bmgapi: A large 12.7x99mm cartridge utilizing a steel projectile and an Ignis Latex core, igniting upon impact and capable of melting through very thick armour, including submarine hulls.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_50bmgdura: A special 12.7x99mm cartridge with a reinforced casing, potent powder and Durasteel projectile, capable of reaching immense speeds and penetrating even the thickest of hulls, causing extreme spawling.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_lwmmg: A bulky, custom built 7.62x51mm Machine Gun that is designed for producing heavy and accurate suppressive fire, albeit sluggishly.
infotexts.entityname.scp_lwmmgmag: Special Purpose Machine Gun Box Magazine
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_lwmmgmag: A bulky 100 round 8.6x70mm belt fed box magazine containing large rounds for use against the more durable creatures of Europa.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_12gslug: A common 12 gauge shotgun shell containing a single large lead projectile, being moderately more effective against armour.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_12gbreachslug: A 12 gauge shotgun shell containing a slug designed for blowing holes through doors, though is atrocious for combat against much of anything.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_12gapslug: A custom tooled 12 gauge shotgun shell, containing a single titanium sabot penetrator meant to better defeat hard armour vests.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_12ghpbtslug: A 12 gauge shotgun shell containing a single, high mass copper jacketed lead projectile designed to expand upon hitting a target. They are much more accurate than standard slugs due to having an areodynamic plastic cone on each projectile, but do nothing against armour.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_12gmagbuck: A 12 Gauge shotgun shell with a stronger powder load and larger shot for maximizing unarmoured lethality, though still fares horribly against armour.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_12devilslug: A 12 gauge shotgun shell containing a small payload of Devil's Blood, dispersing in a small area.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_556apmag: A 30 round 5.56x45mm magazine containing AP ammunition to increase armour effectiveness, though it's small size negatively impacts terminal performance.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_556duramag: A 30 round 5.56x45mm magazine containing overpressure Durasteel ammunition to significantly increase armour effectiveness, it's velocity somewhat remediating the lack of terminal performance.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_9mmapmag: A 20 round 9x19mm magazine containing AP cartridges for making handguns more viable against soft armoured targets, though fairs no better against heavy armour.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_9mmsmgapmag: A 35 round 9x19mm SMG magazine containing AP ammunition, providing better effectiveness against armoured targets.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_45incendmag: A 10 round 11.4x23mm magazine meant for pistols, containing FMJ-IL cartridges meant to cause severe burns upon impact.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_357apround: A 9x33mm cartridge featuring a Depleted Uranium projectile for increased effectiveness against armour, however notably effects overall performance.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_anaconda: A 10.9x33mm revolver featuring a larger cartridge than the Service Revolver. It has a moderately heavy double action trigger mechanism.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_44round: A 10.9x33mm FMJ Cartridge, for a long time it considered the most powerful handgun cartridge on Earth, a title which was revoked by cartridges such as 12.7x33mm and 12.7x55mm, which are currently the largest (and least practical) handgun cartridges on Europa.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_44apround: A 10.9x33mm cartridge with a dense, heavy Depleted Uranium projectile, being much better against armour however notably reduces terminal effect.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_m249: An old and boxy 5.56x45mm Light Machine Gun using the same ammunition as the commonly found Coalition Assault Rifle, making ammunition interchangable and accumulated heat lower.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_m249mag: A 100 round 5.56x45mm box magazine for use in the Coalition Light Machine Gun.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_mdr: A integrally scoped 5.56x45mm bullpup rifle using a full length barrel within a gun the same size as a conventional rifle, it has found favourites despite the burst trigger mechanism meant to conserve ammo.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_welrod: A shoddy 11.4x23mm integrally-suppressed pistol that uses a bolt-action and rubber wipes to mask most of the sound associated with a firearm, making it dead-quiet for the first few shots, but gets progressively louder with use.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_railgunpiercingshe: A large railgun shell using a smaller diameter Titanium kinetic penetrator housed in a sabot. The projectile is propelled at higher velocities and is meant to pierce through hulls and thick armour.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_railgundushell: A railgun shell housing a dense, self sharpening Depleted Uranium kinetic penetrator for near unmatched hull penetration and causes significant spauling, however is very likely to overpenetrate most smaller subs.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_railgunduflechette: A railgun shell housing 15 20mm Depleted Uranium flechettes, meant to pierce through submarine hulls and pepper the inside.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_railgunnukemirvshe: A railgun shell that houses 6 low yield Fission warheads, separating from the main shell and dispersing, making it extremely effective against large groups and medium subs.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_railgundevilbloods: A large shell designed to be fired out of a railgun containing a large payload of Devil's Blood
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_railgunphyspiercin: A large, High Explosive Anti-Sub railgun shell with a Phyiscorium kinetic penetrator and an explosive charge, for piercing a thick hull and detonating after penetrating.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_railgunthermoshell: A heavy shell utilizing a sophisticated implosion type fusion payload for unsurpassable explosive potential, however as a result it has gained a very infamous reputation for being nigh suicide to use.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_railgunerdshell: An unwieldly shell designed to emit an extremely high amount of neutron radiation for a fraction of a second, the resulting immense radiation exposure, material penetration and area contamination invariably fatal to anyone without significant protection. Truely an instrument of suffering.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_railgunbunkerbuste: A railgun shell with a very unconventional warhead, with a Physicorium-Durasteel penetrator and staged charges that have incrementally larger explosive payloads. Given how old it looks, it's evident this design was discontinued despite it's incredible sub and outpost-busting capabilities.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_railgunruinedshell: A railgun shell that is completely unrecognizable, losing it's function a long time ago and is now only useful for scrapping.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_thermodepthcharge: A large depth charge that awkwardly fits in a loader. It features a miniaturized and sophisticated implosion type fusion design. Given it doesn't need to be particularly fast, a larger warhead can be used, significantly increasing explosive potential and makes it an even more dangerous choice.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_tsarshell: Now I am become death, the destroyer of worlds.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_f1: A large grenade with a thick fragmentation sleeve and large explosive payload, making it hard to throw. It has a 6.5m explosion radius and a 20m frag radius.
infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_gravgrenade: An odd explosive that uses a dementonite core to cause a gravity well, bringing nearby creatures into itself, damaging them as it gets into the core. It has a 2m damaging radius, with a 9m gravity well.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_m67: A baseball style fragmentation grenade with a Depleted Uranium shell, the resulting fragmentation causing radiation poisoning. It has a 4.5m explosion radius and a 10m frag radius.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_dm51: A rather large grenade, dispersing aerosolized ignis latex into the air and rapidly ignited. It has a massive 12 metre blast radius.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_latexgrenade: A nasty chemical weapon that can be thrown to coat an area in Preso Latex. Usage without protection is ill-advised.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_rpg7: A simple 40mm recoilless muzzle loading launcher, as a result of not being restricted to the bore diameter, it is able to use a variety of warhead types for different purposes. As a result, it has found favourites outside of the Seperatists.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_rpg7he: A 40mm fragmentation warhead for use against enemies in close proximity, using a thin steel sleeve akin to standard hand grenades, and has less propellant in the booster.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_rpg7incend: A 40mm HE warhead with an Incendium charge, capable of causing large fires.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_rpg7phys: A 40mm HEAS warhead comprised mostly of Physicorium, having good penetration potential whilst still providing an explosive payload.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_rpg7latex: A 40mm warhead with a chemical payload containing Preso Latex, coating everything nearby.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_rpg7devilblood: A 40mm warhead with a chemical payload containing Devil's Blood, allowing for long distance chemical warfare.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_rpg7du: A 40mm warhead made mostly of Depleted Uranium, lacking much of any raw explosive power but allows for vastly better penetration of submarines, causing heavy spalling upon penetration.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_mgl: A 40x46mm Grenade Launcher utilising a 3 round tube magazine, it is capable of firing a somewhat quick burst of curated ordnance, at the cost of a tedious reload.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_pipebomb: An improvised explosive that is easy to produce and is popular among Separatist insiders, despite it's low explosive potential compared to standard issue grenades.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_ag36: A small 40x46mm grenade launcher designed to be a more portable means of explosive ordnance compared to the older GL. Its compact nature sacrifices velocity and accuracy however.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_devilsbloodexplosi: A block of Chlorine Trifluoride laced with Devil's Blood, causing a large explosion that is invariably lethal to anyone nearby.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_devilsgrenade: A grenade containing weapons grade Devil's Blood. Use is heavily discouraged without protective equipment.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_morbusinegasgrenad: A tightly sealed grenade containing a highly potent nerve agent, dispersing it within a small area. Protection is mandatory as the nerve agent is rapidly absorbed through the skin.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_hexgasgrenade: A gas-tight grenade holding the elusive and extremely toxic Hexa-Nova Gas, capable of killing a human within seconds in a gruesome, agonizing manner. Using without significant protection is suicide.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_40mmgrenadelatex: A 40mm grenade containing a Preso Latex payload, contaminating the impact area upon exploding.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_40mmgrenadedevil: A 40mm grenade containing a Devil's Blood payload, contaminating the impact area upon exploding.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_40mmgrenadehex: A 40mm grenade containing the elusive and extremely toxic Hexa-Nova Gas, contaminating the impact area upon exploding.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_40mmdugrenade: A 40mm grenade housing a solid Depleted Uranium projectile, it's sheer density crushing through bone and armour alike.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_40mmdirtygrenade: A 40mm grenade containing a Uranium shell underneath the main warhead, intended to spread around and contaminate an area.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_psigrenade: A strange and unwieldy device, it presumably explodes.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_at4: A lightweight 84mm Disposable Launcher which has become an excellent tool against submarines and outposts, it is loaded with a single HEDP projectile for effect against both groups and armour.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_fuelrodbomb: An oxygen tank mixed with welding fuel, rigged to turn a fuel rod into a irradiating explosive.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_uniquegrenadelaunc: A 40x46mm grenade featuring a 3 shell tube.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_rpg7nuclear: A 40mm grenade featuring a very heavy, low yield fission warhead, it's weight drastically reducing it's speed but delivers a massive boom.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_nuclearbomb: A heavy device housing a low yield fission warhead, useful for providing nuclear firepower in regular railgun shells or for developing more powerful WMDs.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_m107: A very large and intimidating 12.7x99mm semi-automatic Anti-Materiel Rifle, the sheer heft of the recoil can easily knock someone unprepared off their feet, or worse.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_m107fmjmag: A big and boxy 10 round 12.7x99mm magazine containing Full Metal Jacket ammunition.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_m107apimag: A big and boxy 10 round 12.7x99mm magazine contaning armour Piercing-Incendiary ammunition.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_rpt93: A large and powerful multi-calibre Machine Gun, able to take both GPMG and HMG magazines.
infotexts.entityname.scp_rpt93mag: Prototype Heavy Machine Gun Box Magazine
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_rpt93mag: A bulky and very heavy 150 round 9.3x64mm belt fed box magazine.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_uts15: A heavy and boxy 12 Gauge shotgun with unprecidented capacity and close range firepower compared to other shotguns, making it perfect for dealing with a particularly hardy enemy or a large group of targets.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_ks23: A 6 Gauge powerhouse of a Shotgun, having a small capacity though fires shells that hit like an entire submarine.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_4gshell: A 6 Gauge shotgun shell containing large and heavy buckshot, which is utterly devastating against unarmoured targets and to some degree armoured targets via sheer blunt force.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_4gslug: A 6 Gauge shotgun shell with a very large AP slug, its sheer mass capable of crushing soft tissue and armour alike.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_rsh14: A large 14.5x114mm revolver using a ridiculously large calibre for a pistol, as a result making it immensely recoil intense but can stop almost anything in it's tracks.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_erevolverround: A 14.5x114mm Anti-Materiel round providing unsurpassable stopping power.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_ma37: An experimental 7.62x51mm/12.7x55mm Hybrid Battle Rifle, featuring a bullpup design and top of the line ergonomics meant to make the weapon as powerful but controllable as possible.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_ma37mag: A 32 round 7.62x51mm box magazine containing special, high velocity cartridges.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_mk18: A long 8.6x70mm Precision Rifle that is the pinaccle of long range stopping power and precision, acting as an in-between for 7.62mm rifles and 12.7mm rifles.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_mk18mag: A 10 round 8.6x70mm box magazine containing armour piercing ammunition for the greatest amount of armour penetration and stopping power against any armoured Europan creatures.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_taucannon: A highly experimental device using a miniaturized particle accelerator, fuelled by fissile material cells to lanch high mass elementary particles at .10C, the immense kinetic energy and heat of the projectile capable of blowing most things apart and penetrate deep into materials even with extremely high compressive strength.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_taucannonuranium: A cell of 10 Uranium-235 pellets for use within the Particle Accelerator Cannon. These pellets provide a small amount of power to the weapon thus making the accelerator eject the high mass particles out at a slower velocity, detonating on impact.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_taucannonthorium: A cell of 8 Thorium-228 pellets for use within the Particle Accelerator Cannon, providing a greater amount of power to the accelerator, increasing velocity and penetration.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_taucannonfulgurium: A Fulgurium enriched Thorium cell containing 6 pellets. Said pellets are so powerful that the Tau particles have been measured to be moving at near 1c velocities. The discharge will expose anyone nearby to massive amounts of radiation.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_hk433: A lightweight 5.56x45mm Assault Rifle with an excellent cyclic rate and accuracy without producing significant recoil due to its calibre and muzzle brake. Comes with a 40mm UGL, as well as the feature to drop magazines automaticially when emptied.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_ak15zlobin: A modernized Renegade Oppressor Assault Rifle, featuring heavily updated furniture and an unconventional magwell and auto-regulating gas system, able to feed both 7.62x39mm and 5.45x39mm cartridges. Comes with a 40mm UGL, as well as the feature to drop magazines automaticially when emptied.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_mxa3: A heavily revised 6.5x39mm Caseless Assault Rifle designed to overcome the flaws of the previous design, utilizing lighter and tougher durasteel recoil springs and bullpup design, adopting a longer barrel for better engagement ranges. Due to the new manual of arms, less-skilled users tend to use the Burst function.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_smaw: An 83mm rocket lanching system that remains a formidable weapon against submarines.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_smawrocketcontaine: An 83mm HEDP warhead capable of decimating most submarine hulls and surrounding individuals.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_ruger9: A sleek and compact 9x19mm pistol that's essentially a glorified machine pistol, providing excellent firepower and accuracy compared to other autoloading handguns. It's calibre however is it's primary downside.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_p90: A bullpup 5.7x28mm PDW that is highly concealable and easy to operate, providing excellent controllability, accuracy and a very high firerate, however the cartidges it uses despite their penetration characteristics do very poor individual damage.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_p90mag: A 50 round 5.7x28mm magazine that is to inserted on top of the Personal Defence Weapon, providing a large amount of ammunition despite the low stopping power of the ammo contained.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_microgun: An incredibly heavy 5.56x45mm Rotary Machine Gun with an internal motor and self-charging battery system.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_microgunmag: A very heavy 200 round 5.56x45mm box of FMJ cartridges.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_fnx45: A finely tuned 11.4x23mm pistol with a light slide, reinforced Durasteel recoil spring and crisp competition grade trigger, allowing for fast and accurate shots.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_m6: A strange but elegant 12.7x33mm powerhouse of a handgun, with state-of-the-art closed bolt mechanism and Durasteel recoil spring able to significantly dampen the recoil impulses.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_railgunlauncher: A humongous launcher with large electromagnets that require a huge amount of power, however it can wreak havoc on an unprepared outpost or submarine.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_vector: A boxy 9x19/11.4x23mm SMG using a unique delayed blowback operation for recoil mitigation purposes, this allows for an immensely fast hyperburst without the overwhelming recoil.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_customrifle: A 12.7x55mm Bolt Action Rifle not often seen given it's calibre, however is significantly more powerful than it's predecessor and is very hard to handle upon firing.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_aa12: An advanced 12 Gauge Semi-Automatic shotgun feeding from Renegade Combat Shotgun magazines, capable of quickly decimating anything inside a corridor or nest. The trigger however is extremely clunky for an individual not used to it.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_magnus: An Assault Revolver utilizing an unorthodox and unconventional cylinder and barrel to allow for firing almost every revolver cartridge. As a result of the weird trigger linkage to the cylinder it takes a lot of skill to fire quickly.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_portablecoilgun: A very large weapon meant to function as a coilgun, firing a Durasteel slug at high speeds and penetrating several walls and people.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_coilgunclip: A 20 round clip containing 11mm Durasteel slugs meant to be projected at hypersonic speeds.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_harpooncoillaunche: A large 2 handed harpoon gun using larger and more powerful coils to propel harpoons at break-neck speed, significantly increasing it's damage and AP potential.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_granatgevar: A weird 40mm launcher able to load 2 individual grenades via a bizzare Physicorium-Dementonite baffle used to absorb exhaust gasses and dual electric firing pin mechanism.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_m9bayonet: A rugged fighting knife intended for hand to hand combat, though still performs very poorly against any form of armour.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_m9bayonettitan: A combat knife made mostly out of Titanium, providing better characteristics against armoured targets.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_improvmachete: A crude looking machete ideal for an engineer or mechanic to defend themselves, but does a poor job against armour.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_machete: A large blade used for more utilitarian jobs than the diving knife, though it's capable of doing decent damge to armour.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_dementonitemachete: A heavy and sturdy blade more designed for a combat role, made to be more capable against armour.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_physicoriumsword: A large yet light blade made of Physicorium, capable of cutting through significant amounts of armour.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_dementonitemachete: A Dementonite Machete which has a thin coating of Preso Latex, allowing for a hit and run on a target or disorienting them in combat, this however means there is reduced impact on the target.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_baton: A simple collapsable steel baton with a rubber coating, for use as a cheap, non-lethal means of discouragement.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_sledge: A large, heavy tool used for bashing down doors or breaking hulls though can be used as an improvised weapon.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_sledgetitan: A sledgehammer with a hardened head designed to bash straight through most hulls.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_sledgeclown: A sledgehammer comprised of mostly rubber and plastic, making it do nothing more that scuff some paint if not in the hands of a clown.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_submissionbaton: A heavy duty baton capable of storing significantly more power for quickly disabling a dangerous individual. Its large capacitors require metal shielding around the base of the baton for durability's sake, increasing weight and making it more difficult to wield.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_shiv: A brittle improvised blade made from a screwdriver. Either this is a last resort or someone's not a fan of someone on board.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_crowbar: A brittle and sharp bar fashioned from a shiv. Either this is a last resort or someone's really not a fan of someone on board.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_batoncontra: A crudely modified baton intended to be used as a form of club, whilst being quite a hefty hitter, it's very fragile given it's terrible build quality.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_contrawelder: A crudely modified welding tool meant to inflict severe burns, however is liable to melt on itself and explode after even short usage.
infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_shield: A smaller, but overall more durable shield option that allows better defense from constant fire than the Riot Shield. It's balanced enough for one hand, allowing the use of equipment while keeping it in harms way, though it does get in the way of using any melee weapons.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_starboundorgan: A blocky looking instrument vaguely resembling an electric keyboard, how a person holds this is anyone's guess.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_starboundguitar: A blocky looking guitar that is awkward to hold in the hands.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_starboundharmonica: A blocky looking harmonica that resembles a brick more than an instrument.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_memehorn: An object resembling a bike horn that appears to emit random noises when the ball is compressed.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_ak103: A rugged and highly infamous 7.62x39mm Assault Rifle that has become an icon of the Separatist movement, it's relative ease of manufacturing and powerful cartridges making it the go-to choice for an insurrection against armoured Coalition.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_akmag: A polymer 30 round 7.62x39mm magazine containing FMJ cartridges, which are powerful at close range though tend to fair horrendously at longer distances.
infotexts.entityname.scp_akdrummag: Renegade Oppressor Assault Rifle Drum Magazine
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_akdrummag: A 50 round 7.62x39mm Drum Magazine predominantly containing FMJ cartridges used within RPK style rifles, however can fit in any magwell designed for 7.62x39 magazines.
infotexts.entityname.scp_akapmag: Renegade Oppressor Assault Rifle AP Magazine
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_akapmag: A polymer 30 round 7.62x39mm magazine containing Titanium AP cartridges, providing greater penetration at the cost of very poor yawing and fragmentation.
infotexts.entityname.scp_akdumag: Renegade Oppressor Assault Rifle DU Magazine
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_akdumag: A polymer 30 round 7.62x39mm magazine containing Depleted Uranium ammunition, capable of penetrating through thick body armour and poisoning the target, though this results in near non-existent yawing and frag.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_aks74u: A rugged 5.45x39mm Carbine meant for confined spaces. It's' easily concealable and has a high fire rate, however is very inaccurate and has a significantly higher gas intake.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_ak74mag: A polymer 30 round 5.45x39mm magazine, the cartridge is easier to fabricate than 5.56x45, though suffers from lesser accuracy and lack of yawing and fragmentation.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_ak74apmag: A polymer 30 round 5.45x39mm magazine containing AP ammunition for use against armour, though sacrifices a large degree of already low yawing and frag.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_ak74dumag: A polymer 30 round 5.45x39mm magazine containing Depleted Uranium ammunition, capable of taking on more sophisticated armour and poisoning the target, though this results in near non-existent yawing and frag.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_ak74extmag: A bulky polymer 60 round 5.45x39mm drum magazine, maximizing uptime before needing to reload.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_ak74m: A rugged 5.45x39mm Assault Rifle that has become a primary armament for the Separatists. Being easily produced and hidden away, this rifle is the go-to for a quick mugging or mutiny.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_g36: A burst fire 5.45x39mm rifle that is well made for a Separatist weapon, using a built-in scope for better accuracy. It uses an atypical 5-round burst, as to work better in close-quarters than it's counterpart. Given enough time this rifle may replace the current rudimentary standard issue rifles the Separatists currently use.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_mg36: A modified Renegade Precision AR meant for serving in a machine gun role, being significantly lighter and better handling than the higher calibre options, but meagre raw firepower compared to them.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_mp443: A boxy 9x19mm pistol seen in the hands of Separatists given it's simple nature, it suffers from poor accuracy and recoil compared to it's Coalition counterpart.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_pm: A quickly crafted 9x19mm pistol using an incredibly basic recoil system and using as little materials as possible, making it excellent as a disposable pistol. Due to this however it has significant recoil impulses due to the primitive recoil system and has an awful habit of misfeeding.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_rpk74m: A rugged 5.45x39mm Light Machine Gun featuring a longer, thicker barrel for sustained fire, however due to its length and lack of a folding stock, it is very difficult to conceal.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_kh2020: A 6.5x39mm bullpup rifle favoured by the more notable Separatists given it's balance between power and fire rate. It's however much less accurate than it's conventional counterpart due to the awful trigger pull.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_65bullmag: A stamped steel 25 round 6.5x39mm caseless magazine used in the Renegade Caseless Assault Rifle, being easier to produce however carries less ammunition.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_rhino: A 9x33mm revolver which has the barrel positioned at the bottom chamber of the cylinder, reducing muzzle climb when firing, however increases height over bore, reducing accuracy.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_sawnoff: An incredibly short 12 gauge shotgun that is designed for concealment in mind, however the short twin barrels significantly reduce accuracy and velocity as well as limiting the user to only 2 shots.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_pkp: An old, hefty 7.62x51mm GPMG designed for providing powerful sustained fire against a large group, or for just simply hozing down a few people in close proximity.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_saiga12: A 12 Gauge magazine fed combat shotgun, it's much easier to load to full with it's dedicated magazines, but has significant recoil due to the basic long stroke system.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_saigamag: A 5 round 12 gauge magazine containing slugs, making it better for accuracy and armour despite the low capacity.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_saigaextmag: A 10 round 12 gauge magazine containing buckshot.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_saigadrummag: A bulky 20 round 12 gauge drum magazine containing buckshot shells that rattle a lot.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_uzi: A basic 9x19mm open bolt SMG hailing from a stamped steel design, making it significantly easier to produce though sacrifices most modern ergonomics.
infotexts.entityname.scp_pkpsmallboxmag: Small General Purpose Machine Gun Magazine
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_pkpsmallboxmag: A 50 round 7.62x51mm belt fed box magazine for General Purpose Machine Guns.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_sr1: A blocky 11.4x23mm pistol, used as an easily producable version of the Coalition's heavy sidearm. It has a notably weaker recoil spring, though this allows the slide to cycle faster.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_osv96: A 12.7x99mm Bolt Action Anti-Materiel Rifle made to be a simpler and more accessible weapon than the Coalition's AMR, it features a 3 round internal magazine which tends to not feed correctly.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_sr2: A compact 11.4x23mm SMG used by the Separatists, it's firerate can shred through unarmoured targets however it's barrel leaves a lot to be desired.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_nagant: An old 7.62x54mmR bolt action rifle with a just as old optic attached to it.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_nagantmag: A simple and old 5 round 7.62x54mmR clip.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_nagantprojectile: a 7.62mm cartridge that is known for being the oldest cartridge in military service.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_sr3: A custom built 5.45x39mm assault rifle using a Covert AR as a base, featuring a Physicorium baffle suppressor for maximum suppression and accuracy.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_valbigmag: A very large custom built 9x39mm magazine holding 40 rounds.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_kir: An Oppressor Battle Rifle heavily modified for assassinations, featuring a semi-auto control group and an experimental Physicorium baffle suppressor for maximum suppression and accuracy.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_kirmag: A somewhat heavy 12.7x55mm magazine full of subsonic ammunition capable of imparting a large degree of kinetic energy upon the target.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_fal: An old 7.62x51mm Battle Rifle titled as the Right Arm of the Free World back on Earth. Now mostly serving as a relic of a long lost past.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_ar15762: An old looking 7.62x35mm assault rifle that appears to have a lot of wear and blood on it, its original owner likely long parted from it.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_300mag: A worn looking magazine containing 25 7.62x35mm cartridges.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_gm6: A sleek, bullpup style 12.7x108mm Anti-Materiel Rifle that is very much a rare specimen, likely brought over from Earth by a very select few.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_gm6mag: A big and boxy 5 round 12.7x108mm magazine containing Full Metal Jacket ammunition.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_dmr540: A highly modernized 7.62x51mm Marksman Rifle hailing from the same failed weapons program as the Hammerhead, being made to replace both the Battle Rifle and the Marksman Rifle. As this rifle is no longer produced, it is extremely rare. A skilled Rifleman can make better use of this weapon.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_dmr540mag: A double stack 20 round 7.62x67mm box magazine containing specialist armour Piercing ammunition featuring a titanium penetrating core.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_m35a2: A strangely pristine 5.56x45mm Bullpup Assault Rifle. Hailing from a cancelled Coalition weapons program from recent events, these rifles are incredibly rare despite their overall superior characteristics to the current issue rifles.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_m35a2mag: A surprisingly lightweight quad stack 50 round 5.7x48mm Box Magazine.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_mxa1warsky: A modified Coalition Caseless Assault Rifle that appears to have been very heavily used by its original owner. The phrase 'Beta mayor got trashed.' has been etched onto the left side of the lower receiver.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_ash12unique: An Oppressor Battle Rifle heavily modified by a Protectorate, having a custom gas tube for a significantly higher fire rate and a custom muzzle brake to mitigate the added recoil somewhat.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_hk21: A weird looking GPMG based on the Renegade BR, using GPMG boxes and capable of laying waste to a whole corridor in quick notice.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_sa80a3: A 6.5x39mm Assault Rifle based on a British design with a bullpup configuration, providing greater accuracy and velocity, though noticably increases recoil.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_g3ka4: A compact 7.62x51mm Battle Rifle utilising a roller delayed blowback operation for more reliable cycling, however requires an overall heavier bolt to accomplish, increasing recoil impulses.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_m29: A very old and worn 10.9x33mm revolver that looks to have been some sort of trophy, might still work.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_r8: A modified 9x33mm Service Revolver that has been almost entirely overhauled, featuring a light trigger and an 8 round cylinder.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_spas12: A blocky 12 gauge shotgun with no stock, though is able to quickly empty its tube at anything unfortunate enough to be close.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_akms: A very old looking 7.62x39mm rifle using a very uncomfortable folding stock and primitive muzzle brake. The wood handguard is in surprisingly good shape given where it came from.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_m16a3: An old and battle worn 5.56x45mm Assault Rifle that looks heavily used by it's previous owner, featuring rust and a 40mm UGL.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_pkm: A very old looking 7.62x51mm GPMG, with a custom lightweight bolt carrier and expanded gas tube allowing for a significantly higher fire rate, though makes it incredibly recoil intensive.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_g17: A rather blocky but reliable 9x19mm pistol, evidently being an older design of self-loading pistol. It has kept surprisingly intact despite it's apparent age.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_rsh50: A 12.7x99mm Assault Revolver that has been modified to take Anti-Materiel Cartridges, who did this and why is unknown given the ridiculous recoil.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_domique: A very old 12 gauge shotgun being one the first examples of dual environment bolt systems, it was a standard issue gun for security until more capable firearms were adapted and produced.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_g36c: A 5.56x45mm Assault Carbine that was once used by the Coalition, however the Separatists used this design for their Precision AR.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_akliv: A heavily modified Renegade Oppressor AR chambered in 7.62x39mm, with a custom gas block and more ergonomic furniture.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_svu: A well-aged 7.62x51mm bullpup marksman rifle. It's worn in places that indicate use while remaining well-maintained, but there is notable damage that say it's seen some anomalies in its time. A skilled Rifleman can make better use of this weapon.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_sg550mli: A heavily modified Coalition AR with substantially better furniture, being rechambered for 6.5x39mm to further increase it's viability.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_usp45: A blocky 11.4x23mm pistol likely of Separatist origin, being heavily modified by the previous owner.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_ds200: A compact double action 12.7x55mm revolver, why anyone would want a cartridge in such a small design with a short barrel is anyone's guess, though makes an impressive fireball.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_bw5: A hefty 12.7x55mm rifle hailing from a very old under-over shotgun design, firing two powerful shots simultaneously but the recoil is immense for untrained users.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_mars: A massive, ridiculously bulky 15.5x50mm pistol in an equally massive cartridge, resembling a small cannon more than a pistol.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_annihilator: A very heavy and ancient looking 11.4x30mm SMG with no stock, giving it some horrible recoil though it's impressive fire rate is more than enough to compensate.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_cursedbr: A bizzare cobbled together rifle of unknown origin.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_rsc: An ancient design of self loading rifle strangely rechambered to 7.62x67mm, it's wood is heavily worn but it's internals weirdly preserved. A skilled Rifleman can make better use of this weapon.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_ag4: A Renegade Battle Rifle which appears to be in pristine condition, attaching a bizzare experimental Incendium device, used to embue projectiles with intense heat. Whether it works or not is questionable.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_ag4heatcoil: A weirdly designed coil unit attaching to the receiver and top of the handguard, being good for 100 shots when fully charged. Can be recharged within a reloading fabricator.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_condor: An Oppressor Heavy Pistol with a bizzare muzzle meant to fit an equally as bizzare device to discharge a large volume of powdered Uranium onto the projectile.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_condorradmuzzle: A beefy muzzle device housing a container of powdered Uranium, released upon firing and contaminating an area upon projectile impact.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.scp_presolatexinfe: The patient's dermal, subcutaneous and muscle tissues are rapidly being converted into Preso Latex. The affected areas beginning to rapidly shut down, with the patient's skin turning an anoxic black.
infotexts.afflictioncauseofdeath.scp_presolatexinf: Turned into a lifeless rubber statue.
infotexts.afflictioncauseofdeathself.scp_presolate: You have been converted into a lifeless rubber statue of your former self.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.scp_devilpoisoning: The patient's skin is slowly becoming vividly flushed, the epidermal and dermal tissues showing apparent signs of spontaneous hemorrhaging, along with the patient suffering from severe expistaxis and subconjunctival hemorrhages to the major eye blood vessels.
infotexts.afflictioncauseofdeathself.scp_devilpois: Your internal organs have been liquefied by Devil's Blood.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.scp_wastingdisease: The patient's CNS is showing signs of severe atrophy from a rare but infamous Prion disease. The eyes fail to focus and their cognition is beginning to rapidly deteriorate.
infotexts.descscpswdmin: The patient is showing obvious symptoms of Submariner's Wasting Disease, their eyes failing to focus and face difficulties with manipulation.
infotexts.descscpswdmod: The patient is showing advanced stages of SWD, constantly vomiting and finding it impossible recognize anything.
infotexts.descscpswdsev: The patient's SWD has seriously damaged most of the CNS, the patient's body beginning to shut down, their vision and movement severely hindered.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.hastenoanim: Movement speed and reflexes are heightened.
infotexts.afflictioncauseofdeath.scp_wastingdiseas: Died from CNS atrophy via Submariner's Wasting Disease.
infotexts.afflictioncauseofdeathself.scp_wastingdi: Your CNS was atrophied away by Submariner's Wasting Disease.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.scp_lineavirus: The patient is showing signs of infection with Brunhes Lineavirus, experiencing symptoms such as laboured breathing, extreme coughing fits and gastrointestinal inflammation. The epidermal tissue turning a horrifically vivid green is a significant indicator of this infection.
infotexts.afflictioncauseofdeathself.scp_lineaviru: You succumbed to the Brunhes Lineavirus.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.scp_lineaviruscont: Not meant to be seen, handles infection logic
infotexts.afflictiondescription.scp_vomiting: The patient's GI tract is significantly disturbed by something, near constantly having to stop in order to vomit, the signs of hematemesis visible as blood is beginning to appear.
infotexts.afflictioncauseofdeathself.scp_vomiting: You have choked on your own vomit.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.scp_vomitingblood: The patient's GI tract is showing signs of rupturing, occasionally vomiting large volumes of blood.
infotexts.afflictioncauseofdeathself.scp_vomitingb: You have bled to death internally.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.scp_ae035damage: Strange, blackened marks can be seen on the patient, the mark itself and the local tissue completely numb to any sensation.
infotexts.afflictioncauseofdeathself.scp_ae035dama: Your cells atrophied away into nothing.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.scp_hexgasdamage: The patient is experiencing rapid degredation of the CNS, cardiovascular and muscular systems, their skin growing necrotic before your eyes.
infotexts.afflictioncauseofdeath.scp_hexgasdamage: Rapidly burnt away on the inside and out.
infotexts.afflictioncauseofdeathself.scp_hexgasdam: You haved died from the effects of Hexa-Nova exposure.
infotexts.descscppresomin: The patient's upper cutaneous skin layers are beginning to grow an anoxic black, a sense of numbness present in the affected areas.
infotexts.descscppresomod: The patient's body is growing lethargic, the Preso Latex converting the subcutaneous tissue layers and clouding their vision.
infotexts.descscppresosev: The patient's internal organs are being rapidly converted, their consciousness rapidly degrading and are showing signs of respiratory arrest.
infotexts.descscppresomax: The patient has entirely turned into a completely lifeless rubber statue inside and out, the skin cold to the touch.
infotexts.descscpdevilmin: The patient's skin is growing strangely sore looking, with the ears and eyes beginning to spontaneously bleed.
infotexts.descscpdevilmod: The patient's mouth is dripping with blood and the skin is developing bleeding lesions that pour out blood at an alarming rate.
infotexts.descscpdevilsev: The patient is rapidly falling into hypovolemic shock as blood pours out of every oraphace, the skin all over gushing out blood.
infotexts.descscpdevilmax: The patient has been completely exsanguinated, a bloody mess of ruptured veins and arteries is all that's left.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.scp_firelatexburn: The patient is suffering severe burns that encompass the entire body part internally and externally, causing unfathomable pain.
infotexts.afflictioncauseofdeathself.scp_firelatex: Your body was incinerated via Ignis Latex.
infotexts.scpfirelatexburnmin: The patient has Ignis Latex stuck onto their body, the tissue damage however appears minimal for the time being.
infotexts.scpfirelatexburnmod: The patient is experiencing significant burn damage from Ignis Latex, the injury seeping deep into the affected body part.
infotexts.scpfirelatexburnsev: The patient is suffering severe Ignis Latex burns that encompass the entire body part internally and externally, leaving a horrific scene.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.sgt_painkiller: Patient seems to be more tolerant of existing injuries.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.sgt_painkiller.sel: That really takes the edge off of things.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_bodyrig: A standard issue vest featuring a bandolier for the storage of ammunition.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_heavyvest: A modernized version of the current Coalition vests, further designed to protect against rifle projectiles and will likely become Coalition standard issue at some point despite the weight.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_heavyrig: A futher modified Coalition carrier, meant to further increase combat effectiveness, featuring pouches and extremity coverage. This does however noticably increase weight.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_specialrig: A large, intimidating vest using advanced anti-ballistic materials to provide excellent protection from most rifle threats. As it's specifically designed for outpost assaulting, it's a poor choice for daily usage.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_renegadespecialrig: An incredibly bulky looking vest designed as the Separatist's cheaper alternative to the Coalition's Special Rig, however the lesser materials makes it incredibly cumbersome.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_simplehelmet: A very basic steel helmet that provides protection against sharp objects, however is only marginally effective against projectiles given the helmet's build.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_combathelmet: An upgrade package to the standard issue Coalition headgear for better protection against the ever increasing proliferation of rifles and AP projectiles. It has a ballistic mandible and visor which worsens vision.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_heavycombathelmet: A hefty helmet using advanced anti-ballistic materials to protect against AP rifle threats, however is pretty heavy and significantly obstructs vision.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_renegadeheavyhelme: A heavier, cheaper version of the Coalition's alternative using simpler, thicker layers of armour to compete against similar threats, severely obstructing vision as a consequence.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_renegadecaptainhat: A basic hat made to identify the wearer's allegiance.
infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_coalitioncaptainha: A dress hat made to identify the wearer's allegiance.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_alienhelmet: A large helmet of alien origin which encompasses the entire head and is strangely suited for human anatomy.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_assaultpack: A conveniently sized backpack designed for everyday use. Almost anyone can find a use for such a utile pack, from combat medic work, to mining missions and infantry combat.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_heavypack: A gigantic backpack that can almost fit another person in, mainly used for salvage missions or for very long hauls. It's inherent weight and bulkiness severely hampers the wearer's capabilities however.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_tacpack: A more spacious pack designed to store more equipment, however is naturally bulkier as a result.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_protopack: A top of the line, low profile pack using a heavy duty Durasteel frame and large weapon mount, making carrying a heavy weapon around significantly easier.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_fieldpack: An even larger and heavier pack meant for long distance dives or storing lots of combat equipment, though puts quite the strain on the wearer.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_renegadevest: A soft armour vest designed to provide basic protection against low velocity small arms whilst being easy for an insurgent to create. It has small pockets for storing things.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_heavyuniform: A low profile suit designed for where explosives are a hazard. It provides protection against fragmentation, though has marginal ballistic protection alongside being heavier than standard uniforms.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_heavyrenuniform: A bulkier alternative to the Coalition's frag suit featuring mostly thin steel armour inserts. it's heavier and more awkward to move in but will regardless protect the user.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_renegadeplatecarri: A vest using older steel plate designs to provide protection, whilst more capable than it's soft alternative, it's bulkier than the Coalition's standard vests.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_heavyhazmatuniform: A modified HAZMAT Suit with a full seal to protect the skin from exposure to hazards, intended for use alongside a CBRN-capable mask for full protection.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_liquidatorsuit: A low profile diving suit made predominantly of experimental Lead-Dementonite radiation shielding, able to protect against emissions from almost any radiological threat, though is very awkward to walk with. Has a pressure rating of 6,500m.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_heavymechanicsuit: A set of overalls which have been designed to further protect against cuts and crushes caused by operating and maintaining mechanical devices.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_heavymechanicsuitb: A set of overalls which have been designed to further protect against cuts and crushes caused by operating and maintaining mechanical devices.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_combatmedicuniform: A uniform sporting a unique looking camouflage, featuring thick aramid padding and larger pockets for equipment.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_renegadecombatmedi: A uniform meant to distinguish the wearer from Coalition medics, however is made with less materials and compromises protection and capacity for greater agility.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_renegadeuniform: A standard issue Separatist uniform, providing negligable protection though is more flexible.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_renegadehelmet: An easily producible helmet used by the Jovian Separatists providing protection against most threats, though due to basic materials it faulters against most Coalition helmets.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_renegadedivingsuit: A diving suit utilised by Jovian Separatists to show which faction they are a part of, it has been designed to protect mostly against small arms fire. Has a depth rating of 6,000m.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_renegadecaptainuni: A uniform worn by Jovian Separatist captains featuring aramid layers to provide negligible protection against small arms.
infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_coalitioncaptainun: A well-set dress uniform worn by Coalition captains tailored with aramid layers to protect against small arms fire.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_combathardsuit: A powerhouse of a Diving Suit meant for heavy combat, featuring thick anti-ballistic materials and sharp angles to maximize deflection. However this suit severely hampers tool usage in addition to poorer oxygen cycling efficiency. It's servomotors are also incredibly power hungry and rapidly drain battery cells.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_softvest: A lightweight and low profile vest made of aramid, making it more comfortable to wear but is much less effective against high velocity projectiles. A shoulder pad allows for more comfortable shouldering of weapons.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_riotvest: A basic vest with internal and external padding for use against bladed and blunt attacks, however fairs extremely poorly against small arms fire.
infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_securityvest: A full-body set of dampening pads and inlays to maximize defense against cuts and blunt strikes, as to handle biting creatures and violent individuals alike.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_bulldozerhelm: An extremely heavy and bulky helmet with a large plate in front, providing near inpenetrable protection against small arms fire. As a result of the front plate's small eyeholes it dramatically reduces the wearer's field of vision and ability to equip items.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_yuihelmet: A low profile helmet composed of Prototype composite materials making it light and protective, the visor housing an augmented reality headset for significantly increasing the wearer's combat capabilities. The feline shape is presumably to represent agility.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_livhelmet: A heavy duty Phyisicorium helmet housing an experimental augmented reality headset, for significantly increasing the wearer's combat capabilities. The canine shape is presumably to represent raw power
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_yuirig: A low profile vest that uses intricate Durasteel-Titanium Dragon Skin plating, making it respectively protective whilst staying light.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_livrig: A heavily customized and maintained Renegade Carrier with thick Physicorium-Polymer plates on the front, back and sides for maximum protection.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_specopsuniform: A Renegade Frag Suit that has had a significant overhaul by the previous user, using advanced aramid and flexible materials around joints.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_livuniform: An advanced undersuit being the pinnacle of Separatist equipment, using an experimental Durasteel-Silicon Carbide plating for decent protection against both frag and firearms.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_marauderuniform: A very heavily customized uniform that utilizes rifle rated armour and thicker aramid layers.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_veronuniform: A hardy undersuit designed to protect against non-AP rifle threats whilst significantly enhancing anti-explosive properties. While it's not required for the paired armor, the rigging makes the long-term use more comfortable.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_marauderrig: A top of the line, low profile vest using Durasteel-Physicorium plates, designed to minimize bulk and maximize protection.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_marauderhelmet: A top of the line, low profile helmet using the same materials it's counterpart vest uses, allowing for a lightweight and highly protective helmet.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_veronrig: An imposing and durable armored suit with protection and storage in mind, made for taking heavy hits whilst having plenty of ammunition to stay in the fight.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_veronhelmet: A large helmet that encompasses the entire head in rifle rated armour, using Durasteel alloys to significantly reduce weight.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_lightuniform: A 2-piece, professional looking Coalition BDU, providing a comfortable means of identifying oneself.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_hazmathelmet: A lead lined hood made of a hydrophobic synthetic fabric meant to be either draped over or tucked into a uniform. It features a hardened diving mask with thicker rubber parts to better protect against more penetrating radiation.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_cbrnsuit: A 1-piece hydrophobic suit designed for radiological and chemical protection with some level of anti-ballistic ability, intended for use alongside a CBRN-capable mask for full protection
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_cbrnhelmet: A combat helmet fitted with a Hardened Diving Mask, intending for use with a CBRN Suit. Though it does hinder vision more than using just the mask alone, having some ballistic protection may
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_hardeneddivingmask: A modernized, heavy duty diving mask that both provides a degree of protection for the face and a more efficient SCBA system. It has better filtration, allowing use for CBRN.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_clownbatuniform: A clown outfit made for protecting the Honkmother's servants.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_clownbatmask: A full-face Ballistic mask for both protecting against lower velocity projectiles whilst preserving your beliefs.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_interceptorsuit: An experimental combat suit built upon an existing Slipsuit, using shark biomimicry to minimize water resistance for significantly better water travel. It also features Durasteel armour plating to make it more effective against small arms.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_sevasuit: A unique and ballistic-rated CBRN suit that comes attached with sealed headgear, letting it be used on its' own without a separate CBRN Respirator, though the self-contained system requires a tank mounted, and is notably inefficient.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_replicatinglatex: An unusual and highly toxic polymer synthesized from Elastin plants, capable of replicating tissue into more of itself via a poorly understood mutagenic process with animal cells. Must be contained in a Containment Box to handle safely.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_firelatex: A synthetic polymer which undergoes a strong exothermic reaction upon application onto a surface. It is a major component in most lethal chemical weapons and bulk production of ammo propellant. Must be contained in a Containment Box to handle safely.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_pistolkit: A weapon parts kit containing various trigger mechanisms, frames, hammers and more for constructing pistol calibre weapons.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_shotgunkit: A weapon parts kit containing various furniture, receivers, tube sizes and more for constructing shotgun calibre weapons.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_riflekit: A weapon parts kit containing various operating systems, receivers, bolt carriers and more for constructing rifle calibre firearms.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_sniperkit: A weapon parts kit containing various free floating furniture, reinforced receivers and scope schematics used to make various precision weapons.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_machinegunkit: A big weapon parts kit containing various heavy duty furniture, reinforced receivers and feed covers for constructing heavy duty machine guns.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_explosiveskit: A big weapon parts kit containing various furniture and reinforced receivers for constructing explosive weapons.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_basicparts: A bundle of various rudimentary parts made from mostly common materials, of questionable quality, for developing Separatist weapons.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_taucannonparts: A very heavy and expensive weapon kit containing what is essentially the assembly for a micro particle accelerator, requiring lots of fine tuned parts.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_wrecktools: A bunch of ruined tools that have lost their use from years of water damage and erosion, however may yield some useful materials when deconstructed.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_wreckfuel: A few old fuel rods that have been left neglected in a submarine for many years. The vast majority of the fuel has long decayed into Lead, however may still be salvaged.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_wreckglowingfuel: Old fuel rods that emit an eerie greenish-blue glow. It's evident they still have some life in them, with U-235 and Th-232 traces producing relatively high levels of alpha particles.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_wreckarmor: A messy collection of scraps from various clothing and armour pieces, the water degradation has left most of it useless.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_erlangshenium: A mysterious ore with very unnatural looking, brightly glowing cracks on the rock's surface. It is screaming with radioactivity and lights the environment up in an eerie cyan hue. Containing it within radiation shielded containers is mandatory for safety.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_noxcium: A vivid green crystal, constantly releasing immensely high levels of ionizing radiation. Containing it within radiation shielded containers is mandatory for safety.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_wreckweapons: An incoherent assortment of rusted weapon parts which are warped and corroded beyond any use. Some materials may be able to be salvaged.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_wreckammo: A dilapidated pile of random magazines and loose ammuntion in unusable condition, only being useful for salvaging whatever's left.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_wreckflashpowder: A very old powder bottle that is impossible to open normally as a result of the metal cap being rusted shut.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_wreckfractal: A pile of random pieces of rock and icy metals from Fractal items and structures, with some rare materials likely hiding within.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_wreckchem: A worn looking waterproof crate presumably containing various chemicals.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_wreckmetalpile: A neglected and heavily rusted pile of metal, potentially being salvagable.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_wreckammocrate: An old, heavy box that's sat in the water for a very long time, regardless the contents should be relatively intact.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_weaponcraftinfodoc: A single page document glancing over the very basics of producing firearms and ammunition on a submarine.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_chemdoc: A document pertaining to the production of chemical weapons.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_ruinedcoilgunammob: A neglected ammo box which is heavily water damaged, the ammunition unusable and only good for salvaging.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_presowaste: A congealed Preso Latex mess of what appeared to be someone or something.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_wrecknuclearcrate: A heavily worn crate likely containing long lost materials for various nuclear applications.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_tungsten: A very strong metal with the highest melting point of any other, it has a large variety of applications in both armour and armour piercing munitions. It's also useful for creating high durability, although very expensive, weapon parts.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_effigium: A highly reflective and dense material, holding it feels strange as if the metal itself is binding with your skin.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_wreckorepile: An unorganized pile of various pieces of Europan rock and fragments of ore, some of it may be worth salvaging.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_smallweaponcase: A very worn looking box potentially containing handguns or SMGs, however the locks have been rusted shut to the point of being impossible to open.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_largeweaponcase: A very worn looking box potentially containing rifles or shotguns, the polymer case however has fused together and the lock is completely rusted shut.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_durasteel: A novel superalloy of Steel, Titanium and Thorium providing vastly superior strength than TiAl+. As a result it is the best option for armour, AP ammo and tough barrels and receivers despite it's cost to manufacture.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_durasteelmunitions: A heavy-duty case of Durasteel projectiles and high strength casings designed to withstand significantly higher powder loads. These are very sparingly produced as a result of their manufacturing costs and are exclusively handed out to high ranking Coalition members.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_hexanovagent: A teflon, gas-tight container full of a highly volatile compound of concentrated Devil's Blood and Ignis Latex. Acting as a poison unfathomably more toxic than any other option, it is truely an instrument of Satan.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_fractalore: An cluster of various alien materials covered in strangely fine and extremely sharp hairs, constantly pricking every part of the body that makes contact with it.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_wreckexplosivescas: An old and ruined shipment of explosive items, which are hopefully still somewhat intact.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_prototypeusb: A reinforced storage stick containing 2 single use authentication keys, providing the ability to fabricate prototype weapons. The keys themselves are no longer produced and heavily encrypted, meaning the only viable ones can be found in wrecks or abandoned outposts.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_smallcivkit: A small kit full of common treatments for non life-threatening injuries, it is found all across Europa due to it's ease of production and is required by Coalition safety standards. Fresh kits have 4 uses, and will heal the target limb.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_largecivkit: A large derivative of the smaller first aid kit, containing more supplies for greater injuries or simply dealing with minor injuries in a large crew.
